item.title: Setup Python Environment
item.description: Introduction Whenever I want to start a new Python project, I used to go for the standard venv included with Python. But, I easily got rid of it, since the folder it creates makes my editor too clumsy. Afterwards, I discovered Pipenv and I was very happy with it, until I figured out that it doesn’t work well with some packages (e.g. colorama), since it specifies the platform type in the Pipfile.
